documents.title: lincolnshire police will commit extra people to tackle rural crime
text: we heard earlier from the nfu that police need to be `` more mobile '' to counter rural crime .
after a meeting this afternoon bill skelly , lincolnshire 's chief constable has re-iterated his commitment to tackling the problem :

at a meeting with the nfu today , police were told that despite hare-coursing being a problem which has existed `` for generations '' , current gangs are `` more organised and more threatening '' than before .
but police are confident things will improve :
we may not stop the problem completely but i am confident farmers will see a change for the better in the near future .
for more on this story , tune into look north at 18:30 tonight on bbc one .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: why not match these mums ? # peoplescup
text: six months ago , many of these mums were just watching their kids play .
now they 're getting ready to play in the fa people 's cup
it 's not too late to enter this year 's fa people 's cup - the deadline to sign up is midnight on sunday .
entry is completely free , there are categories for everyone and you can enter either as a team or an individual player .

documents.title: football : imps aim for the 'impossible ' in fa cup
text: national league leaders lincoln city will aim to `` achieve the impossible '' against premier league side burnley in the fa cup fifth round .
the imps have reached the last 16 for the first time in 130 years .
victory on saturday would see them become the first non-league team to reach the quarter-finals since 1925 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pony dies after `` sickening '' treatment by former owners
text: yesterday we covered the sad story about lasso and bullseye the ponies , they 'd been taken to equine charity bransby horses after police found them in `` sickening '' condition .
in the last few minutes bransby horses have told us that lasso ( has died .
bransby took both ponies into care , lasso was in a particularly bad condition .
despite them giving him a plasma transfusion , he had fluid in his lungs and would have developed pneumonia .
vets decided to put him to sleep this afternoon .
lasso took a turn for the worst , and we had to put him down .
it 's just such a horrible end to what 's been a horrible week .
author: Nicola Gilroy
Presenter - BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grantham 'time team ' discovery
text: it seems that lincolnshire county council 's budget could n't quite stretch to get tony robinson in to unveil discoveries at the grantham southern relief road
but the council has published a video showcasing some `` unexpected archaological finds '' at the site of the new relief road .
discoveries made include pottery , a cemetery , and remains of a house from roman times and the iron age .
if you fancy watching the full film have a look here .
the grantham relief road is soon entering the next phase of the project which will see the road linking the a1 with the current work on the a52 .

BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: county department store may close lincoln and gainsborough branches
text: oldrids and downtown says it may have to cease trading in lincoln and gainsborough .
the chain of stores - which began life in boston in 1804 - has said that current `` tough trading conditions '' have led to the decision .
the group also says that because it does n't own those premises outright that they may have to close .
95 staff work across the two shops ; oldrids & downtown say staff will be taken through a consultation process .
despite the unquestionable commitment and effort that the staff across both stores have made over the last 4 years we are sadly left with no alternative but to take this difficult decision .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: mod 'ill equipped to deal with ptsd ' says partner of forces veteran
text: the partner of a forces veteran says the mod and the nhs are `` ill equipped '' to treat post traumatic stress disorder .
eileen womersley from heighington near lincoln , says her partner suffered ptsd after several tours in iraq .
she 's been telling the victoria derbyshire show that her partner was told to `` man up '' and given sleeping pills in an attempt to treat her .
a study in the lancet says people serving in the armed forces are n't encouraged to talk about the condition and often suffer alone .
eileen says the mod and the nhs are ill equipped to deal with the complex issue :

BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: driver involved in ambulance crash dies
text: a driver who was involved in a crash with an ambulance in lincolnshire has died .
it 's been revealed by lincolnshire police that the man - who was driving a silver vectra ( at the time - was only admitted to hospital three weeks after the incident .
the accident also involved an ambulance , and black toyata prius and happened on the a607 at waddington on 25 january .
five people were injured - including the ambulance crew .
lincolnshire police are appealing for witnesses who may have seen the driver of `` a dark coloured vehicle '' which was behind the silver vectra in a line of traffic when it happened .
`` i appeal for any witnesses to this collision who have not already spoken to the police to contact me .
in particular , i would like the driver of the car following the silver vauxhall vectra to call me , as a witness , to help add to the information in our enquiry '' .

the decision on the fitties ' future now goes to another committee at north east lincolnshire council .

documents.title: referendum on council structure scrapped
text: a vote on a. plan to scrap some of lincolnshire 's councils and replace them with one unitary body wo n't happen in may .

documents.title: will conference give lincolnshire the edge over archers rival ?
text: we told you earlier that a conference is being held at the university of lincoln for academics interested in the archers .
what you may not have realised is that this move could be a decisive blow in a war that has raged in the fandom of the radio 4 drama for years !

everyone knows that the archers is set in the fictional village of ambridge but did you know that the inspiration behind it could be rippingale in the south of the county and that this could be the real-life bull pub ?
this is hotly disputed by the village of inkberrow in worcestershire , who claim that it 's their village that provided the muse for series creator godfrey baseley .
mr baseley never said which one it was but i have n't heard about any archers conferences in worcestershire

documents.title: hate crime : disabled and lgbt community bearing the brunt
text: you may remember yesterday we told you that hate crime had spiked in the county since the brexit vote .

we got in touch with lincolnshire police and they said the increase is n't because of the vote and in fact it 's disabled and lgbt people who are the main victims - rather than people who were born in other countries .
between july and september of last year 78 hate crimes were reported in the county .
police and crime commissioner marc jones says it might be down to people feeling they can report crimes more :
there 's two sides to the stats .
it 's always concerning but we 've been working hard to make sure those groups feel as though they can report these incidents so it 's very pleasing that they 're trusting the system .
but it is of course concerning that they 're happening at all and that is something we need to work on . ''
author: Alex Rhodes

documents.title: hate crime : do n't blame brexit says pcc
text: the police and crime commissioner says that brexit ca n't be blamed for a rise in hate crime in lincolnshire .
latest figures show a 59 % increase since the referendum .
but the marc jones says the county has n't had more cases because of the vote to leave the eu
we have n't .
two years ago back in 2014 we had more incidents over that same three month period than we 've had this year .

documents.title: hate crime rise : police say increase is n't due to brexit
text: more now on the increase of hate crime in the county .
figures show there 's been a significant increase in the number reported in lincolnshire ; up by 59 % - with a total of 78 incidents .

lincolnshire police say that there was `` no sharp increase in racially or religiously motivated crime in the aftermath of the brexit vote '' and that the reason for the rise is that people are now more prepared to report such crimes :

the increase in reporting comes against the backdrop of a multi-agency strategy and delivery plan which has since 2015 ( pre dating brexit ) set out to tackle issues of under reporting amongst all hate crime victims .
in fact the biggest increases in reporting have been seen from disability and lgbt strands within the community .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lincoln castle scoops top visitengland award

the county council 's executive councillor for heritage , nick worth , said the people who work there made it all possible .
staff and volunteers do a great job of bringing it all to life in a visitor experience to remember .
many of them were mentioned individually by name in the report for their personable , friendly and knowledgeable interactions with visitors , so i 'm overjoyed for them .

text: a grantham man who broke into a house and attempted to rape a frail , elderly woman in her bed has been jailed for 14 years .

the victim has since died but lincoln crown court heard that her death was unrelated to the incident .

willis , who during his trial admitted sexual assault on the victim , denied attempted rape saying that although he had no memory of what happened he would never have committed such an horrific offence .
mark watson , in mitigation , said willis apologised to the victim and her family for what he had done .

documents.title: skydock arms seizures : history of the site
text: here 's a little background on the premises now owned by skydock where a police operation to seize thousands of firearms is currently underway .
it 's no stranger to being an arsenal , it used to be raf foldingworth .
after a brief stint as an active air station it became a nuclear weapons store in the 1950s .
in times of crisis , bombs would be dispatched to other bases like raf coningsby or raf scampton to arm v bombers like the vulcan .
from 1968 the uk 's nuclear weapons were stored on submarines and the base was deactivated a few years later .

documents.title: farmers fears over potential additive ban
text: there are fears pig farmers in lincolnshire could be affected by a potential ban on an additive commonly added to pig feed .
zinc oxide helps develop immune systems in piglets , but there are fears it damages the environment and the eu wants to ban it .
without it , pigs need to be given antibiotics which cost more .
georgina crayford from the national pig association says the chemical ban would have big repercussions for the industry :
we estimate that it 's used in 70 % to 90 % of all piglet diets .
if we were to lose zinc oxide then it would affect a massive part of the industry .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: fine for 'farm waste ' trailer man
text: a horncastle man has been slapped with a £ 1,400 fine for displaying an advert on the side of a large lorry trailer without permission .
several requests were made to andrew riddel to remove the trailer from jubilee way in the town but he failed to comply .
east lindsey council eventually took him to court over the matter where he pleaded guilty and was ordered to pay the fine as well as costs of £ 765.34 and a victim surcharge of £ 140 .
the advert has now been removed .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: cathedral cash : money will bring 'extra 125,000 visitors a year '
text: more now on the £ 11.4m coming the cathedral 's way courtesy of the heritage lottery fund .
some of the new facilities that staff want to build include a new cafe , shop and education suite .
they also want to use it to help renovate and conserve the gallery of kings and exchequergate arch .
perhaps most exciting of all is the plan to reopen some of the grounds that have been closed off for decades including the dean 's green .

the team behind the plans hope that the improvements will help make the most of the building and bring in an extra 125,000 visitors a year and bring in an additional estimated profit of £ 500,000 per year .

today 's announcement represents a huge amount of incredibly hard work by staff and volunteers , and their legacy will be a cathedral that will continue to thrive as a place of excellent worship , and of awe and wonder for visitors from around the world
author: Paul Russell

margaret wilson was one of those caught in it and died the day after .

chan will be sentenced next month .
